title: proposal: make "_ := x" legal if there is no harm to do so.
body:
Reasons:
1. "var _ = x" is legal.
2. Often, in debugging/developing a program, programmers often change a line like 
> _, newV, _ := x, y, z

to
> _, _, _ := x, y, z

and change them back and forth for several times.

But " _, _, _ := x, y, z" is illegal, programmer must change it to "_, _, _ = x, y, z". 
This may be a small inconvenience, but it is really annoying.
